Interface UserManagement

All Known Implementing Classes:
Stormpath
public interface UserManagement

An interface that is used for UserManagement APIs

Author:
Ervin

Method Detail

authenticateAccount

boolean authenticateAccount(java.lang.String user,
                            java.lang.String pass)
Returns true if the correct password is correct for the account given account

Parameters:
user - The username of the account
pass - The Password of the account
Returns:
boolean true if the credentials are correct

createAccount

void createAccount(java.lang.String givenName,
                   java.lang.String surname,
                   java.lang.String username,
                   java.lang.String password,
                   java.lang.String email,
                   java.lang.String group)
Creates an account

Parameters:
givenName - The given name of the account holder
surname - The surname of the account holder
username - The username of the account holder (defaults to email if null)
password - The Password of the account
email - The email adress of the account holder, cannot be null
group - The authorization group that you want the account to belong to (can be null)

getDetails

java.lang.String getDetails(java.lang.String username)
Method to get some details of an account in a string

Parameters:
username - username of the account
Returns:
String returns a message string with information eg. Username: John
Group: Teacher

setPassword

boolean setPassword(java.lang.String username,
                    java.lang.String password)
Method to set the password in an account

Parameters:
username - Username of the account
password - New Password
Returns:
boolean

getAuthorizationGroup

java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getAuthorizationGroup(java.lang.String username)
Returns an ArrayList of the names of authorization groups

Parameters:
username - The Username of the account
Returns:
ArrayList

getPermission

java.util.ArrayList<Permission> getPermission(java.lang.String user)
Will return some Permissions that has a name eg Assignment 1 and some permissions with it in an array eg [Permission.WRITE, Permission.READ]

Parameters:
user - the user you are querying
Returns:
ArrayList a list of permissions
